revised_title: Fractal Crushing of Ice and Brittle Solids: A New Model
tldr: This article presents a model for the fractal crushing of ice and brittle solids. The model explains the observed scale effect in ice forces and predicts a relation between force and area consistent with field observations. The research also shows that the fragment size distribution in broken materials has a fractal character, with a fractal dimension typically around 2.5.
